articles.title: These Australians are terrified they'll lose their chance at kidney transplants because of the coronavirus - ABC News
articles.description: Many Australians are impatiently waiting for lockdown to end. But for those on kidney transplant waiting lists, their lives may depend on it.
articles.content:
Updated 
April 19, 2020 13:57:33
Karrin Clarke had been on the transplant waiting list for five years when she recently missed a call she thought might be "the one". 
"My daughter saw the number as well and she went to start packing her bags," the 43-year-… [+8776 chars]

articles.title: Why we may never get a COVID-19 vaccine - Observer
articles.description: An eminent Australian vaccine inventor says COVID-19 may never have a preventive vaccine, but could possibly burn out.
articles.content:
One of Australia's most eminent vaccine developers says there may never be a vaccine against COVID-19 for some very good reasons.
Professor Ian Frazer, the immunologist who co-invented the human papilloma virus (HPV) vaccine which prevents cervical cancer, s… [+4647 chars]

articles.title: Nurses Push Back on Pressure to Work Without Right Equipment - Medscape
articles.description: As the pandemic continues, hospital nurses are insisting on N95 masks instead of surgical masks. 'I went into nursing with a passion for helping," said one, "but not under the conditions we're under.'
articles.content:
Editor's note: Find the latest COVID-19 news and guidance in Medscape's Coronavirus Resource Center.
Nurse Mike Gulick was meticulous about not bringing the coronavirus home to his wife and their 2-year-old daughter. He'd stop at a hotel after work just to t… [+6496 chars]

articles.author: Jasper Lindell
articles.title: Canberrans face medication shortages after drug raised as potential COVID-19 treatment - The Canberra Times
articles.description: People who take hydroxychloroquine for lupus and rheumatoid arthritis say they have struggled to fill their regular prescriptions.
